card.name: Acidic Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: This permanent deals 2 damage to target creature or player."
card.flavor: The first sliver burst against the cave wall, and others piled in behind to deepen the new tunnel.

card.name: Amoeboid Changeling
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{T}: Target creature gains all creature types until end of turn.
{T}: Target creature loses all creature types until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If a creature loses all creature types but then gains a new creature type later in the turn, it will be that new creature type.

card.name: Ancient Ziggurat
card.ability: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a creature spell.
card.flavor: Built in honor of Alara's creatures, the ziggurat vanished long ago. When Progenitus awakened, the temple emerged again.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : Mana produced by Ancient Ziggurat can be spent on any part of a creature spell's total cost. This includes additional costs (such as kicker) and alternative costs (such as evoke or Worldheart Phoenix's alternative cost).
2/1/2009 : Mana produced by Ancient Ziggurat can't be spent on activated abilities that put a creature card directly onto the battlefield, such as unearth or ninjutsu.

card.name: Aphetto Dredging
card.ability: Return up to three target creature cards of the creature type of your choice from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Phage became both executioner and savior, helping others to the same rebirth she had found.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You need to choose the creature type before choosing the targets.

card.name: Armor Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."
card.flavor:
Hanna: "We must learn how they protect each other."
Mirri: "After they're done trying to kill us, all right?"

card.name: Barbed Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
card.flavor: Spans of spines leapt from one sliver to the next, forming a deadly hedge around the Weatherlight.

card.name: Brood Sliver
card.ability: Whenever a Sliver deals combat damage to a player, its controller may put a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Within weeks, more slivers nested in Otaria than ever existed on Rath.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card's controller controls the triggered ability, but the controller of the Sliver that deals damage to a player decides whether or not to put the token onto the battlefield under their control.

card.name: Clot Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."
card.flavor:
"One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Coat of Arms
card.ability: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
card.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
10/4/2004 : If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
10/1/2009 : Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

card.name: Crystalline Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability only applies while this card is on the battlefield.

card.name: Distant Melody
card.ability: Choose a creature type. Draw a card for each permanent you control of that type.
card.flavor: Oona's song is like a twisted dinner chime. All the faeries return home, but it is Oona who feasts—on the stolen dreams and rumors they serve her.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : Note that this spell counts the number of permanents you control of the chosen type, not just the number of creatures you control. It will also take your tribal permanents into account.

card.name: Frenzy Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have frenzy 1. (Whenever a Sliver attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
card.flavor: The Arturan conjurers took the strange, alien fossil and patterned their own twisted creations in its image.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Fungus Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have "Whenever this creature is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it." (The damage is dealt before the counter is put on.)
card.flavor:
"When a sliver of this breed enters the hive, the others claw each other in frenzied fits, thereby ensuring their rapid growth."
—Rukarumel, field journal

card.name: Fury Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have double strike.
card.flavor:
"A rift opened, and our arrows were abruptly stilled. To move was to push the world. But the sliver's claw still twitched, red wounds appeared in Thed's chest, and ribbons of blood hung in the air."
—Adom Capashen, Benalish hero

card.name: Gemhide Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
card.flavor:
"The land is weary. Even Skyshroud is depleted. We must find another source of mana—one that is growing despite our withering world."
—Freyalise

card.name: Heart Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have haste.
card.flavor: Gerrard looked all around for the source of the mysterious pulse, and at that moment the slivers boiled forth from the crevasses.

card.name: Heartstone
card.ability: Activated abilities of creatures cost {1} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.
card.flavor:
"Finding a true heartstone is even harder than finding a true heart."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The cost reduction can be applied to additional costs.
10/4/2004 : It will not add a {1} to abilities with no generic mana in their activation cost.
10/4/2004 : It will never reduce any colored mana portion of an activation cost.
7/15/2006 : Can’t reduce Snow mana costs.

card.name: Hibernation Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "Pay 2 life: Return this permanent to its owner's hand."
card.flavor: Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.

card.name: Homing Sliver
card.ability:
Each Sliver card in each player's hand has slivercycling {3}.
Slivercycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Sliver card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : Unlike the normal cycling ability, Slivercycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Sliver card. After you find a Sliver card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
2/1/2009 : Slivercycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Slivercycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Plainscycling from being activated.
2/1/2009 : Slivercycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Slivercycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
2/1/2009 : You can choose to find any card with the Sliver creature type, even if it isn't a creature card. This includes, for example, Tribal cards with the Changeling ability. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Sliver card in your graveyard.

card.name: Metallic Sliver
card.flavor: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

card.name: Might Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures get +2/+2.
card.flavor:
"The colossal thing rumbled over the ridge, tree husks crumbling before it. The ones we were already fighting howled as it came, their muscles suddenly surging, and we knew it was time to flee."
—Llanach, Skyshroud ranger

card.name: Muscle Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.
card.flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Yes, it does give the +1/+1 bonus to itself.

card.name: Necrotic Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{3}, Sacrifice this permanent: Destroy target permanent."
card.flavor: Though Volrath is long dead, the slivers have become everything he wanted them to be: mindless instruments of destruction and despair.

card.name: Quick Sliver
card.ability:
Flash
Any player may play Sliver cards as though they had flash.
card.flavor: The directors of the Riptide Project wanted instant results on the sliver experiments. They got their wish.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The first ability applies when this card is not on the battlefield. The second ability applies when this card is on the battlefield.

card.name: Rootbound Crag
card.ability:
Rootbound Crag enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Forest.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : This checks for lands you control with the land type Mountain or Forest, not for lands named Mountain or Forest. The lands it checks for don't have to be basic lands. For example, if you control Temple Garden (a nonbasic land with the land types Forest and Plains), Rootbound Crag will enter the battlefield untapped.
10/1/2009 : As This is entering the battlefield, it checks for lands that are already on the battlefield. It won't see lands that are entering the battlefield at the same time (due to Warp World, for example).

card.name: Rupture Spire
card.ability:
Rupture Spire enters the battlefield tapped.
When Rupture Spire enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Sliver Overlord
card.ability:
{3}: Search your library for a Sliver card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
{3}: Gain control of target Sliver. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: The end of evolution.

card.name: Spectral Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."
card.flavor:
"Sure, I've seen agents of the Cabal here and there. Well, not here, and certainly not in any of the sliver labs. Oh dear, I've said too much."
—Apprentice researcher

card.name: Spined Sliver
card.ability: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
card.flavor:
"Slivers are evil and slivers are sly;
And if you get eaten, then no one will cry."
—Mogg children's rhyme
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If two Spined Slivers are on the battlefield then each blocked sliver gets +2/+2 for each creature blocking it.

card.name: Terramorphic Expanse
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Victual Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 4 life."
card.flavor: "We are kinfolk," explained Karn to the sliver queen. "Just as you need your progeny to complete you, so do I need the pieces of the Legacy to make me whole."

card.name: Virulent Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have poisonous 1. (Whenever a Sliver deals combat damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter. A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

card.name: Vivid Creek
card.ability:
Vivid Creek enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Creek: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Vivid Grove
card.ability:
Vivid Grove enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Grove: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Wild Pair
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, you may search your library for a creature card with the same total power and toughness and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : If you cast a 2/2 Grizzly Bears, for example, you may then search for any creature with total power and toughness 4. It can be 0/4, 1/3, 2/2, or 3/1.
2/1/2007 : The game checks the power and toughness of the creature that just entered the battlefield as it exists on the battlefield. That might mean it's impossible to get another copy of that same card. For example, a Triskelion on the battlefield is 4/4, but a Triskelion in your library is 1/1. The power and toughness might also have been affected while the triggered ability was on the stack (such as with Giant Growth, Sudden Death, or Ovinize).
2/1/2007 : If the creature that entered the battlefield has left the battlefield by the time the ability resolves, use the power and toughness of that creature as it last appeared before leaving the battlefield.
2/1/2007 : If the total power and toughness of the creature that entered the battlefield is less than 0 (due to Bewilder or Sudden Death, for example), it is treated as 0 by Wild Pair. For example, if a creature was -2/1, you could search for a creature with total power and toughness of 0. If either the power or toughness is less than 0, but the total is greater than 0, use the actual total. For example, if the creature is -1/3, you could search for a creature with total power and toughness of 2.

card.name: Winged Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures have flying.
card.flavor:
"Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
